div.p: Greetings from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ.

These good brothers, who bear the letters, will tell you, Heinrich Bullinger, where they found me. In short: there is great effort and the situation is somewhat precarious. But I am not afraid; for the Lord is with me. Within two days, the commissioners, about whom I wrote, will arrive. But the devil opposes me and our gospel with money, and that openly. Pray with the whole church for me, which I earnestly ask of you. The small vessel with the books, which you received from Basel, has not yet been delivered; I beg you, ensure that it does not remain stuck on any rocks any longer; all those books would have already been distributed if they had been delivered. In Zürich, with Mr. Gotthard the merchant, there resides a young man named Peter Paul, the son of a very dear friend of mine. I implore you by your faith, make sure that the father understands that I have sincerely recommended him to you. Farewell and be well with your whole family, school, and church. Given at Chiavenna, February 26, 1553.
To the most distinguished man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, honorable lord and brother. In Zürich.
